revisionDesc.change: Submit - D.Internullo omitted markup for the abbreviations on the verso. I've supplied them.

Submit - Fixed line breaks. Normalized the expansions. Capitalized proper names. Added signa crucis at the beginning of ll. 62, 67, 72, 77, 81, 87 and in l. 90. Added the division between recto and verso. Added the regularization of the name "Ebgenius", l. 67. Added the text of the verso, hitherto unpublished.
Automatic insertion of lb tags into origs to match existing lb tags in the reg
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; changed sic to surplus; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.p: The text on the verso was hitherto unpublished. It bears the topographical data of the land sold in the recto: since it is written in a script that is different from and quite later (VIex-VIIin AD) than that of the recto, it is likely that it corresponds to an endorsement, related to an ancient preservation system.

div.ab:
imperante domino nostro Iustino perpetuo Augusto anno septimo et post consulatum eius secundo anno
quarto, sub die tertio Nonarum Iuniarum, indictione quinta, Ravennae.
scripsiscribsi ego Iohannis forensis rogatus et petitus a Domnino viro honesto,
agellario, filio quondam Ven, civem Caesinatem, ipso praesente,
adstante mihique dictante et consentiente et subter manu
propria pro ignorantia litterarum signum faciente, et testes,
ut subscriberentsuscriberent, conrogavit. constat eum hac die iure optimo et legi
bus sub duplariae rei taxatione distraxisse, et distraxit, atque

Flavius Iohannis, forensis huius splendidissimaesplendedissimae urbis
Ravennatis, habens stationem ad Monitam auri in porti
cum Sacri Palati, scriptor huius instrumenti, complevi.
notitia testium, qui subscripseruntsuscribserunt, id est:
Pascalis, palatinus sacrarum largitionum et monitarius auri, filius quondam Laurenti monitarii.
Eugenius, palatinus sacrarum largitionum, filius Leonti medici ab schola greca.
Moderatus, comitiacus.
Andreas, augustalis, filius quondam Lucernae.
Vitalis, cerearius, filius Leonis.
